intro: Bornmuellera davisii, commonly known as the Davis's bornmuellera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
